page.title: 05King's Sutton Parish Church
page.content:
The Parish Church of St Peter and St Paul was first started before the Domesday Book of 1086 on the site of a Saxon church. It is still much used by the village though there are other active churches: Methodists, Baptists and Roman Catholics. The beautiful spire , which can be seen for miles, is compared with two other local churches in a ditty:
Bloxham for length, Adderbury for strength, King's Sutton for beauty.
The Vicar conducts the following services on Sundays: 8.00am Holy Communion 10.30am Sung Eucharist & Sermon 2.30pm Catachism 6.00pm Evensong & Sermon
